snippet: A new mobile service called Free isn’t quite that, but analysts said it was considerably less expensive than packages offered by existing operators.
abstract: New mobile service called Free aims to offer a low-priced challenge to the three main wireless service operators in France, which has some of the most expensive mobile rates in Europe; service is built around a 19.99 euro plan that includes unlimited domestic and international calls, text messages and mobile data.
lead_paragraph: A new mobile service called Free isn’t quite that, but analysts said it was considerably less expensive than packages offered by existing operators.

headline.seo: Iliad Pushes to Take Over France’s Mobile Phone Market
headline.main: A Low-Priced Rival Pushes to Take Over France’s Mobile Phone Market
headline.print_headline: A Low-Priced Rival Pushes to Take Over France’s Mobile Phone Market
